sentence.Network_en: A headstone praised by Templars is the key.

when this was done , she took an empty jar from a neighbouring grave , brought water , and carefully , most scrupulously sponged the marble headstone and the coping-stone .做完这些，她从邻边的坟墓找来一个空罐子，装满水，小心翼翼地，异常虔敬地擦拭大理石墓碑和压顶石。

entry.def: A headstone is a large stone which stands at one end of a grave, usually with the name of the dead person carved on it.

means.word_mean: 1. the central building block at the top of an arch or vault
2. a stone that is used to mark a grave
